Get file extensions â€” get_file_ext
text: get_file_ext() similar file_ext(), difference returns file extension dot separator (e.g., .csv).

title: Get file extensions â€” get_file_ext
Get file extensions â€” get_file_ext
text: file character vector file paths.

title: Get file extensions â€” get_file_ext
text: character vector containing file extension files.

title: Get file extensions â€” get_file_ext
code: get_file_ext("example.txt") #> [1] ".txt" #> [1] ".txt" # Expected  get_file_ext("/path/to/file.tar.gz") #> [1] ".gz" #> [1] ".gz"  # Expected  get_file_ext("no-extension") #> [1] NA #> [1] NA # Expected  get_file_ext(c("data.csv", "data.rds")) #> [1] ".csv" ".rds" #> [1] ".csv" ".rds" # Expected

what: Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext
title: Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext

title: Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext
Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext
text: file character vector file paths.

title: Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext
text: character vector containing file names without extension part.

title: Get file names without the extension â€” get_file_name_without_ext
code: get_file_name_without_ext("example.txt") #> [1] "example" #> [1] "example" # Expected  get_file_name_without_ext("/path/to/file.tar.gz") #> [1] "file.tar" #> [1] "file.tar"  # Expected  get_file_name_without_ext("no-extension") #> [1] "no-extension" #> [1] "no-extension" # Expected  get_file_name_without_ext(c("data.csv", "data.rds")) #> [1] "data" "data" #> [1] "data" "data" # Expected

what: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
title: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
text: na_as() returns NA value class attributes specific R object. function made facilitate assigning NAs dynamically.

title: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
code: na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'logical' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'character' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'integer' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'numeric' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'Duration' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'Period' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'difftime' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'hms' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'Date' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'hms' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'POSIXct' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'POSIXlt' na_as(x)  # S3 method for class 'Interval' na_as(x)

title: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
text: x atomic vector, provided na_as() method .

title: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
text: NA value class attributes x.

title: Return a NA value of the same type of an R object â€” na_as
code: na_as(TRUE) #> [1] NA #> [1] NA # Expected class(na_as(TRUE)) #> [1] "logical" #> [1] "logical" # Expected  na_as(as.Date("2020-01-01")) #> [1] NA #> [1] NA # Expected class(na_as(as.Date("2020-01-01"))) #> [1] "Date" #> [1] "Date"  # Expected

what: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
text: raw_data_1() returns raw data paths [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] package.

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
text: file (Optional) character vector indicating file name(s) raw data. NULL, raw data file names returned (Default: NULL). package (Optional) character string indicating package database data. NULL, function try use basename working directory (Default: NULL).

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
text: file == NULL, character vector file names available. Else, string file name path.

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_1
code: if (interactive()) { ## To list all raw data file names available    raw_data_1()  ## To get the file path from a specific raw data    raw_data_1(raw_data()[1]) }

code: raw_data_2(type = NULL, file = NULL, package = NULL)

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_2
text: type (Optional) character string indicating file type raw data (Default: NULL). file (Optional) character vector indicating file name(s) raw data (Default: NULL). package (Optional) character string indicating package database data. NULL, function try use basename working directory (Default: NULL).

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_2
text: type = NULL, character vector file type names available. type != NULL file = NULL, character vector file names available type. type != NULL file != NULL, character vector file name(s) path.

title: Get paths to [INSERT PACKAGE NAME] raw data â€” raw_data_2

what: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
title: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
text: remove_outliers() removes outliers numeric vector using either interquartile range (IQR) method standard deviation (SD) method.

title: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
text: x numeric vector remove outliers. method (Optional) character string specifying outlier detection method. Must either "iqr" interquartile range method "sd" standard deviation method (Default: "iqr"). iqr_mult (Optional) numeric multiplier IQR threshold (Default: 1.5). sd_mult (Optional) numeric multiplier standard deviation threshold (Default: 3).

title: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
text: numeric vector outliers removed.

title: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
text: using "iqr" method, values considered outliers Q1 - (iqr_mult * IQR) Q3 + (iqr_mult * IQR), Q1 first quartile, Q3 third quartile, IQR interquartile range. using "sd" method, values considered outliers mean - (sd_mult * SD) mean + (sd_mult * SD), SD standard deviation.

title: Remove outliers from a numeric vector â€” remove_outliers
code: remove_outliers(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), method = "iqr") #> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 #> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 # Expected  remove_outliers(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 10), method = "iqr") #> [1] 1 2 3 4 #> [1] 1 2 3 4 # Expected  remove_outliers(c(1, 5, 6, 7, 10), method = "iqr", iqr_mult = 1) #> [1] 5 6 7 #> [1] 5 6 7 # Expected  remove_outliers(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), method = "sd", sd_mult = 1) #> [1] 2 3 4 #> [1] 2 3 4 # Expected  remove_outliers(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 100), method = "sd", sd_mult = 1) #> [1] 1 2 3 4 #> [1] 1 2 3 4 # Expected

what: Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
title: Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
text: shush() wrapper around suppressMessages() suppressWarnings() allows suppress messages warnings single function call. designed used pipes.

title: Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
text: x expression, usually function call. quiet (Optional) logical flag value indicating whether suppress messages warnings. can used condition messages warnings inside functions (Default: TRUE).

title: Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
text: object x messages warnings suppressed.

title: Suppress messages and warnings â€” shush
code: message("test") |> shush() message("test") |> shush(quiet = FALSE) #> test #> test # Expected  warning("test") |> shush() warning("test") |> shush(quiet = FALSE) #> Warning: test #> Warning: test # Expected

what: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
title: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
text: std_error() computes standard error sample mean.

title: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
text: x numeric vector sample data.

title: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
text: number representing standard error.

title: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error
text: standard error can estimated standard deviation sample (\(\sigma_{\bar{x}}\)) divided square root sample size (\(\sqrt{n}\)). $$\sigma_{\bar{x}} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} \approx \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}}$$

title: Compute the standard error of the sample mean â€” std_error

title: Swap two values if a condition is met â€” swap_if
text: swap_if() swaps two values condition met.

title: Swap two values if a condition is met â€” swap_if
Swap two values if a condition is met â€” swap_if
text: x type R object. y R object class length x. condition logical flag indicating values swapped (Default: TRUE).

title: Swap two values if a condition is met â€” swap_if
text: list swapped values.

title: Swap two values if a condition is met â€” swap_if

what: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
title: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
text: test_outlier() identifies outliers numeric vector using either interquartile range (IQR) method standard deviation (SD) method.

title: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
text: x numeric vector test outliers. method (Optional) character string specifying outlier detection method. Must either "iqr" interquartile range method "sd" standard deviation method (Default: "iqr"). iqr_mult (Optional) numeric multiplier IQR threshold (Default: 1.5). sd_mult (Optional) numeric multiplier standard deviation threshold (Default: 3).

title: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
text: logical vector length x TRUE outliers FALSE non-outliers.

title: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
text: using "iqr" method, values considered outliers Q1 - (iqr_mult * IQR) Q3 + (iqr_mult * IQR), Q1 first quartile, Q3 third quartile, IQR interquartile range. using "sd" method, values considered outliers mean - (sd_mult * SD) mean + (sd_mult * SD), SD standard deviation.

title: Test for outliers in a numeric vector â€” test_outlier
code: test_outlier(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), method = "iqr") #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE # Expected  test_outlier(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 10), method = "iqr") #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE # Expected  test_outlier(c(1, 5, 6, 7, 10), method = "iqr", iqr_mult = 1) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE # Expected  test_outlier(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), method = "sd", sd_mult = 1) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #> [1] TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE # Expected  test_outlier(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 100), method = "sd", sd_mult = 1) #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE # Expected

what: Update package versions in the DESCRIPTION file â€” update_pkg_versions
title: Update package versions in the DESCRIPTION file â€” update_pkg_versions
text: update_pkg_versions() updates version packages listed DESCRIPTION file R package installed versions. package comes typical installation R (e.g., base, utils), function update version previous minor version current R version. made avoid errors CI/CD.

title: Update package versions in the DESCRIPTION file â€” update_pkg_versions
Update package versions in the DESCRIPTION file â€” update_pkg_versions
text: file (Optional) string indicating path DESCRIPTION file. old_r_version (Optional) string indicating previous minor version current R version.

title: Update package versions in the DESCRIPTION file â€” update_pkg_versions
text: invisible NULL. function used side effect.

title: Update the year in system files of a package â€” update_pkg_year
Update the year in system files of a package â€” update_pkg_year
text: file (Optional) character vector indicating path files must updated. Default LICENSE, LICENSE.md, inst/CITATION.

title: Update the year in system files of a package â€” update_pkg_year

what: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
title: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
text: vct_replace_all() replaces values vector specified value.

title: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
code: vct_replace_all(x, replacement = na_as(x), except = NULL, preserve_nas = FALSE)

title: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
text: x atomic vector. replacement (Optional) single value replace values x (Default: na_as(x)). except (Optional) vector values exclude replacement. preserve_nas (Optional) logical flag indicating function must preserve NA values x (Default: FALSE).

title: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
text: type object x values replaced.

title: Replace values in a vector â€” vct_replace_all
code: vct_replace_all(1:10) #>  [1] NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA #> [1] NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA  vct_replace_all(1:10, replacement = 0L, except = 5:7) #>  [1] 0 0 0 0 5 6 7 0 0 0 #> [1] 0 0 0 0 5 6 7 0 0 0  vct_replace_all(c("a", "b", NA, "c"), replacement = "d", preserve_nas = TRUE) #> [1] "d" "d" NA  "d" #> [1] "d" "d" NA  "d"

what: Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
title: Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
text: vector_to_c() put vector c() function. function useful want assign values vector programming R.

title: Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
text: x atomic vector. quote logical flag indicating values wrapped double quotes (Default: TRUE). clipboard logical flag indicating output copied clipboard (Default: TRUE).

title: Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
text: character string values x inside c() function.

title: Put a vector into c() â€” vector_to_c
code: vector_to_c(letters[1:5], clipboard = FALSE) #> c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e") #> [1] "c(\"a\", \"b\", \"c\", \"d\", \"e\")" #> c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e") # Expected  vector_to_c(1:5, quote = FALSE, clipboard = FALSE) #> c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) #> [1] "c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)" #> c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) # Expected
